bug.short_desc: Compiled files found in (SDK) distribution archive

long_desc.thetext:
Several "pyo" and "pyc" files were found in the (SDK) distribution archive. I believe this wasn't intended, as these are compiled files.
Further analysis of this issue showed that this apparently only happens in ".zip" distributions - ".tar.gz" archives are OK. Although I'm not familiar with the release preparation scripts, this suggests a possible issue in "Windows" (or similar) target, as the ".zip" archives are generated to specifically use the CR+LF format in source files.
I think this is already fixed in trunk and legacy. Please re-check.

(In reply to comment #1) > I think this is already fixed in trunk and legacy. Please re-check. I'm not sure if this was meant for the issue reporter (me).
As there is no commit information regarding the issue and I didn't found any reference in commit logs regarding issue 780, I don't have enough information to re-check.
Ok, let's close the bug. If anything will be wrong in newer builds just report this issue again.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
